alert.note: Alert for Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 3:03AM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NEWTON...NORTHERN BARRY...LAWRENCE AND CENTRAL JASPER COUNTIES... At 302 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Jasper to near Mount Vernon to near Galena, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. This storm has a long history of producing wind damage. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Newton, northern Barry, Lawrence and central Jasper Counties, including the following locations... Table Rock Lake, Shell Knob, Carytown, Fidelity, Stotts City, Neck City, Freistatt, Wentworth, Avilla and La Russell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 12 and 49. Interstate 49 between mile markers 36 and 52. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms have produced wide spread wind damage. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
